page.title: 08WILLERSEY DUCK POND
page.content: {Willersey}is a picturesque village with stone houses and wide, well- trimmed verges but its main attraction is the{duck pond}which lies beside the village street. Its circumference is roughly 80 metres and it is surrounded on three sides by grass. The fourth side is bounded by the garden of a large house to which the pond once belonged. In the centre is a small island of Cotswold stones. The ducks not only attract the tourists but also the local people who feed them on stale bread. In 1977 a seat was put beside the pond to commemorate the Queen's Silver Jubilee. Originally the ducks were domestic ones but now they are mainly mallards. These hatch their ducklings in nearby fields and lead them through the village to the pond quite unconcerned about the passing traffic.
